metadata.title: CVE-2023-52600 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: jfs:fix uaf in jfs_evict_inode When the execution of diMount(ipimap) fails, theobject ipimap that has been released may be accessed in diFreeSpecial().Asynchronous ipimap release occurs when rcu_core() calls jfs_free_node().Therefore, when diMount(ipimap) fails, sbi->ipimap should not beinitialized as ipimap.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52600` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-253.287
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-253.287
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-253.287
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-224.236~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-224.236~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-224.236~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1131.141
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1168.183
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1167.180~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1176.191~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1161.178~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1130.141~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
